text:
There are also things about structural zeros. Like `Zero,` and the off-diagonals of a `Diagonal`
You need to use forms that preserve your primals structural zeros, (and it's structure more generally) or you get the wrong time complexity.
(Structural zeros can't be perturbated so should not become value zeros).

Conversely, the introduction of structural zeros from value zeros leads to weirdness, e.g. making something Diagonal when it was only a coincidence that the off diagonsls happened to be zero.
But I think that is a weirdness only for  in the primal computational.
So should not be a problem if you are putting them in the pullbacks.
(Nested AD aside)
